Hello all again,

Still awaiting somebody would lend a helping hand.  I have a simple RMI 
server providing database service supported by a one-file, non-relational 
database.  Database clients pass their object reference to the server when 
connecting, and so the server can detect a dead connection by the following 
if-statement and 
recycles the connection for another client:

       if (clientObject != null && clientObject.equals(null)) { ... }

Right now, I just open a few OS shells (Windows XP) and run the clients to 
connect to the server, manually close a shell, and check the println 
statements I placed in the server to see that it is indeed working.  It would 
be great if a TestCase can simulate that.

Thanks in advance.

Sam

subject: Junit and RMI, please help ...
